comments.author: hsivonen@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Currently, View Source can't deal with highlighting the internal subset of XML files correctly, because the highlighting is based on an HTML tokenizer.

This is a pretty strong WONTFIX in the current technical environment, but in principle this is a bug we have and the interest in fixing this might increase over time (unlikely) or the technical enviroment could change to make this easier (more likely if we start parsing XML using an XML5 parser derived from the HTML5 parser implementation we already use for HTML--assuming that XML5 ends up supporting internal subsets).
comments.creator: hsivonen@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Currently, View Source can't deal with highlighting the internal subset of XML files correctly, because the highlighting is based on an HTML tokenizer.

This is a pretty strong WONTFIX in the current technical environment, but in principle this is a bug we have and the interest in fixing this might increase over time (unlikely) or the technical enviroment could change to make this easier (more likely if we start parsing XML using an XML5 parser derived from the HTML5 parser implementation we already use for HTML--assuming that XML5 ends up supporting internal subsets).

Bulk-downgrade of unassigned, >=5 years untouched DOM/Storage bugs' priority.

If you have reason to believe this is wrong (especially for the severity), please write a comment and ni :jstutte.
